description:
Looking towards the core of the galaxy through the Sagittarius spur as seen from the Kalahari desert deep in the heart of Namibia. 

A test shot with the Sigma Art 50mm. The only shot i took with it before selling it and purchasing the Sigma Art 40mm (which has vastly superior coma correction). You will notice the batwings are very obvious wide open at f/1.4 on this shot if you inspect it closely.

Capture :

Imaged during the September equinox 2019 from the Khomas region of Namibia on the Tropic of Capricorn - 23.4 degrees south. Temperatures were around 10c.

SQM 22.13 - Bortle Class 1
Canon 60D modified by Andy Ellis
Sigma Art 50mm @ f/1.4
30 minutes of integration. 60 x 30 seconds @ ISO 1600
Tracked on a Fornax Lightrack II

Processing :

Calibrated in RawTherapee (Flats, defringe, white balance, noise reduction, AMaZE debayer)
Registered and Integrated in PixInsight
Dynamic Background Extraction
SCNR Green
Masked Stretch x 2
Histogram Transformation
Extracted Luminance Mask
Curves Transformation on Masked Image
title: Galactic Core - Sigma Art 50mm
